cta: Run the prompts and post your output
Open an Issue proposing one improvement (Suggest lane)

items.body_markdown:
## Objective
Learn a repeatable loop for using AI to learn faster without fooling yourself.

## The Loop
1. Define a question + success criteria.
2. Ask for a plan + risks + unknowns.
3. Produce an artifact (notes, spec, draft, code).
4. Red-team the artifact (contradictions, missing evidence, weak assumptions).
5. Iterate once.
6. Publish + invite critique.

## Prompts
- "Help me define success criteria for: <topic>. Give 3 measurable signals."
- "Red-team this plan. Find contradictions and missing premises."
- "Turn the improved plan into a checklist I can follow."

## Output
Post: (a) your success criteria, (b) the first artifact, (c) the red-team findings, (d) what you changed.

items.body_markdown:
## Prompt
Write a short list of tasks you *do not* want your AI to do for you, even if it technically can.

## Why
Agentic delegation is powerful and risky. Your boundaries are part of your operating system.

## Template
- "My AI should never: …"
- "My AI can do with confirmation: …"
- "My AI can do autonomously: …"

- Data governance

items.title: Prompting best practice: make success criteria explicit

evolve: Add common failure modes (overconfidence, missing constraints)

items.body_markdown:
## Idea
Most prompt failures are missing success criteria. Make the AI restate them before it answers.

## Example
Bad: "Write a business plan."
Better: "Write a 1-page plan with: ICP, value prop, 3 risks, 3 experiments, and success metrics."
